main_definition: To stay temporarily at a place, especially in a house or accommodation belonging to someone else.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Find a temporary residence or shelter
meanings_and_examples.example: After getting lost on the hike, they had to lodge themselves for the night at an old cabin.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To put something into a cavity or hole
meanings_and_examples.example: He decided to lodge his spare key underneath the doormat.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A small, often rustic hotel or accommodation; typically located in rural areas or near outdoor activities
meanings_and_examples.example: We booked a cozy lodge by the lake for our winter vacation.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To formally protest against something (often at an international meeting)
meanings_and_examples.example: The two countries decided to lodge separate complaints with the United Nations regarding border disputes.
